feed.title: Jennifer Strejevitch’s blog
feed.subtitle: Minimal, responsive Jekyll theme for hackers.

entry.title: Python For Beginners
entry.content:
Last month I coached a class of Python for beginners for Women Who Code. The people varied from complete beginners, to people who have had a go with other languages.

Some of the things I noticed was that you cannot assume people will run commands on the command line so naturally, and of course, I haven’t always known that either! So I prepared some material inspired by various sources and included a little command line overview.
entry.summary: Last month I coached a class of Python for beginners for Women Who Code. The people varied from complete beginners, to people who have had a go with other languages. Some of the things I noticed was that you cannot assume people will run commands on the command line so naturally, and of course, I haven’t always known that either! So I prepared some material inspired by various sources and included a little command line overview.

entry.title: Unit Testing With Python
entry.content: This is a presentation that I prepared about my findings on unit testing with Python. It was an introduction to mostly non Python developers but everyone was technical. I can say that is one of the first technical presentations I’ve given since Uni and it has helped me gain more confidence to do it again :).
